Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civil Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FELDER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, N.Y. 10013.

Council Member Felder moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Section 202 Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly Los Sures Senior Housing - 145 South 3rd Street, Brooklyn, Community District 1.
Items.MatterName: LU 532 - Housing Program for the Elderly Los Sures Senior Housing - 145 South 3rd Street, Brooklyn, Community District 1.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for immigration reform that provides fair opportunities for persons to apply for legalization of immigration status and citizenship; reiterating the City Council's commitment to working together in coalitions with immigrant, labor, community, business and religious groups to protect the rights of New York's immigrant families; and endorsing the Immigrant Workers Freedom Ride, which will arrive in New York on October 4, 2003 at Flushing Meadow Park in the great borough of Queens and is designed to draw attention to the importance of immigrant rights.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Immigrant Workers Freedom Ride, October 4, 2003

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the Clean Money, Clean Elections Act (A.3453A / S.3440A), a bill that would drastically improve the campaign finance system in New York State by lowering contribution limits, improving reporting requirements and enforcement, and most importantly, instituting a voluntary system of public financing of elections.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Clean Money, Clean Elections Act (A.2630-A, S.1638-A)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 5473-A (A.5473-A), a bill that would amend the current election law to require all polling places be accessible to voters with physical disabilities.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amend the current election law to require all polling places be accessible to voters with physical disabilities. (A.5473-A)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 8841 (A.8841), a bill that would implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 and amend the election law in New York State by, among other things, establishing a uniform administrative complaint procedure for any person who believes there is a violation of Title III of the Help America Vote Act of 2002.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002. (A.8841)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 8834 (A.8834), a bill that would amend the current election law to prevent undervoting by requiring the use of the sensor latch mechanism on Shoup voting machines.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amend the current election law to prevent undervoting by requiring the use of the sensor latch mechanism on Shoup voting machines.  (A.8834)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 8842 (A.8842), a bill that would implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 and amend the election law in New York State by, among other things, establishing a detailed list of voter identification forms for new registrants and providing for a statewide computerized voter registration list.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002. (A.8842)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 8831 (A.8831), a bill that would amend the current paper ballot instructions to explicitly clarify the importance of avoiding casting overvotes and notify voters of their right to a replacement ballot.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Amend the current paper ballot instructions. (A.8831)

Items.Title: Resolution supporting newly amended Chapter 263 of the Laws of New York, 2003, regarding the posting of information relevant to the electoral process, in conformance with the Help America Vote Act of 2002, and urging the adoption of an explicit Voter's Bill of Rights that fully informs the electorate of their fundamental right to cast their vote.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Help America Vote Act of 2002

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign State Assembly Bill 8833 (A.8833), a bill that would implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 and amend the election law in New York State by, among other things, providing for county boards of elections to assume control of voting machines and other functions relating to the election administration process.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002. (A.8833)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Senate to pass and the Governor to sign the Voting Systems Standards Act of 2003 (A.8847), a bill that would implement certain mandates of the Help America Vote Act of 2002 and amend the election law in New York State by, among other things, establishing new standards for voting machines, ensuring access to the ballot by voters with disabilities, adopting a single state-wide voting machine through a competitive bidding process and requiring a voter verifiable audit trail.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Voting Systems Standards Act of 2003.  (A.8847)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges, and Elections

Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections approving the re-designation by the Council of DENNIS LAWRENCE deLEON as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board.

The Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections respectfully reports:

Pursuant to section 440(b)(1) of the New York City Charter, the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections, hereby approves the re-designation by the Council of DENNIS LAWRENCE deLEON as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board to serve for the remainder of a three-year term that expires on July 4, 2006.

This matter was referred to the Committee on September 17, 2003.


Res. No. 

RESOLUTION APPROVING THE RE-DESIGNATION BY THE COUNCIL OF DENNIS LAWRENCE deLEON AS A MEMBER OF THE NEW YORK CITY CIVILIAN COMPLAINT REVIEW BOARD.

By Council Member Comrie

RESOLVED, that pursuant to section 440(b)(1) of the New York City Charter, the Council does hereby approve the re-designation of DENNIS LAWRENCE deLEON as a member of the New York City Civilian Complaint Review Board for the remainder of a three-year term that expires on July 4, 2006.
Items.MatterName: M 740 - Dennis Lawrence deLeon, Civilian Complaint Review Board

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Transportation
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of an advisory board of drivers.
Items.MatterName: Creation of an advisory board of drivers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring air-conditioning on any bus or other motor vehicle transporting a child with a disability to and from school.
Items.MatterName: Requiring air-conditioning on all buses or other motor vehicles engaged in the business of transporting children with disabilities to and from school.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the State Legislature to amend the New York State Navigation Law to require that all operators of mechanically propelled vessels be holders of a boating safety certificate and prohibit children under the age of fifteen from operating such vessels unless accompanied by a certificated person sixteen or older except for the operation of certain vessels with small engines.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Navigation Law

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Occupational Safety and Health Hazard Abatement Board of the New York State Department of Labor to promptly establish strong and enforceable track safety standards to protect transit workers and riders that mirror or exceed the safety standards used by the Federal Railroad Administration.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Track safety standards to protect transit workers and riders.

Commissioner of Deeds
Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass H.R. 260, which would close the background check loophole at gun shows by extending the Brady law to all sales at gun shows.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Close the background check loophole at gun shows by extending the Brady law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to further restrict the issuance of a license for the possession and purchase of firearms
Items.MatterName: Restrict the issuance of a license for the possession and purchase of firearms.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making it a misdemeanor to trespass upon the playing area of a professional sporting event and imposing a civil penalty for those who interfere with a professional sporting event.
Items.MatterName: Trespassing upon the playing area of a professional sporting event a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon President George W. Bush to not decimate funding to the United States Department of Agriculture for activities to thwart the infestation of the Asian Longhorned Beetle.
Items.MatterName: Asian Longhorned Beetle

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter of the city of the city of New York in relation to appealing decisions of the Board of Standards and Appeals granting or denying variances or special permits pursuant to the zoning resolution of the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Appealing decisions of the Board of Standards and Appeals granting or denying variances or special permits pursuant to the zoning resolution of NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of violent video or computer games to minors.
Items.MatterName: The sale of violent video or computer games to minors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to enact legislation to deter discrimination in private clubs by denying tax deductions for business expenses made in association with private clubs that discriminate on the basis of sex, race, or color.
Items.MatterName: Deter discrimination in private clubs

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to support and Congress to pass the Ending Tax Breaks for Discrimination Act of 2003 (H.R. 2418) to deter discrimination by private clubs by denying tax deductions for business expenses made in association with private clubs that discriminate on the basis of sex, race, or color.
Items.MatterName: Ending Tax Breaks for Discrimination Act of 2003 (H.R. 2418)

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass House Joint Resolution 28, a resolution that calls for a voting rights amendment to the United States Constitution to guarantee the right to vote.
Items.MatterName: Voting rights amendment to the United States Constitution to guarantee the right to vote.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Sutphin Boulevard Business Improvement District in the Borough of Queens and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.MatterName: Sutphin Boulevard BID, Queens

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the operation of internet cafés.
Items.MatterName: The operation of internet cafés.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the installation and maintenance of newsstands pursuant to a franchise and the placement of advertising on newsstands and to repeal subdivision d, and to repeal and reenact subdivision h, of section 20-231 of such code.
Items.MatterName: Installation and maintenance of newsstands pursuant to a franchise and the placement of advertising on newsstands.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fire safety in places of public assembly.
Items.MatterName: Fire safety in places of public assembly

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting automobile dealerships from charging consumers for free services offered by the New York City Police Department.
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting auto dealers from charging consumers for free services offered by the NYPD.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prohibition on the sale, lease, rental or operation of motorized scooters.
Items.MatterName: Prohibition on sale, lease, rental or operation of motorized scooters.

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress to hold hearings regarding Senate Bill 1186 and House of Representatives Bill 1264, which provide for a reduction in the backlog of claims for benefits pending with the Department of Veterans Affairs, and calling upon Congress to adopt these bills as expeditiously as possible.
Items.MatterName: Reduction in the backlog of claims for benefits pending with the Dep't of Veterans Affairs

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to adopt House of Representatives Bill 303 and Senate Bill 392, which would permit retired members of the Armed Forces, who have a service-connected disability, to receive both retirement pay and disability compensation; and further calling upon the United States Congress to adopt House of Representatives Bill 2569, which, in addition to permitting retired members of the Armed Forces who have a service-connected disability to receive both retirement pay and disability compensation, would also improve other benefits for veterans and members of the Armed Forces.
Items.MatterName: Improve benefits for veterans and members of the Armed Forces (S.392, H.R. 303)

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress to adopt House of Representatives Bill 270 and Senate Bill 967, collectively known as the "Veterans Equal Treatment Act," which would require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to replace the formula used for the allocation of funds appropriated to the Department of Veterans Affairs for medical care to different geographic regions of the nation, known as the Veterans Equitable Resource Allocation, with a more equitable formula.
Items.MatterName: Veterans Equal Treatment Act (H.R.270, S.967)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 222 West 135 Street, also known as Block 1940, Lot 41, in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Third Party Transfer, 222 West 135 Street, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 256 West 135 Street, also known as Block 1940, Lot 53, in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Third Party Transfer, 256 West 135 Street, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 141 West 126 Street, also known as Block 1911, Lot 115, in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Third Party Transfer, 141 West 126 Street, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 325 Lenox Avenue, also known as Block 1911, Lot 31, in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Third Party Transfer, 325 Lenox Avenue, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the department of housing preservation and development to approve the transfer of the property located at 121 West 126 Street, also known as Block 1911, Lot 22, in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Third Party Transfer, 121 West 126 Street, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Administrative Code, in relation to creating a Referenda Finance Program within the current Campaign Finance Program.
Items.MatterName: Creating a Referenda Finance Program within the current Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the electrical code.
Items.MatterName: Electrical Code

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to building safety.
Items.MatterName: Building Safety

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Veterans Affairs to maintain current levels of inpatient and outpatient medical care at the Manhattan Veterans Affairs Medical Center.
Items.MatterName: US Dep't of Veterans Affairs to maintain current levels of inpatient and outpatient medical care at the Manhattan Veterans Affairs Medical Center.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of sixteen applications for certification of eligibility to apply for New York State Wage Tax Credits under the Zone Equivalent Area provisions of the New York State Empire Zones Program.
Items.MatterName: Support of nineteen applications for certification of eligibility to apply for NYS Wage Tax Credits under the Zone Equivalent Area provisions of the NYS Empire Zones Program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to specify trauma centers and emergency departments as recipients of federal funds for emergency preparedness in order to ensure the maximum receipt of funding available to these entities.
Items.MatterName: Congress to specify trauma centers and emergency departments as recipients of federal funds for emergency preparedness.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the City of New York to support efforts by the New York State Attorney General to fight the New Source Review rule recently adopted by the Bush Administration that eases rules on emissions from power plants.
Items.MatterName: Support efforts by the NYS Attorney General to fight the New Source Review rule on emissions from power plants.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to maintain a database of outstanding permits.
Items.MatterName: Dep't of buildings to maintain database of outstanding permits
